data.title: Bob the Builder
data.statement:
A terrible tragedy has struck Bobsville, demolishing all of your father's work. As Bob the Builder, it is your duty to rebuild the town! 

You’ve been given a plot of land represented by a 2D grid. Each cell contains a number from {{1}} to {{3}} (inclusive), indicating the <<elevation of that piece>> of land.

Bob wants to build rectangular homes of height [[a]] and length [[b]]. In order to maintain stability, the house can only be built on land that’s <<all at the same elevation>> and must <<not>> be rotated in any direction.

Your task is to output the <<top-left coordinate>> (0-based) of the <<first>> valid area found. If a valid area isn't found, output {{Not Found}}. The first valid area being the <<top-most>> and <<left-most>> coordinates.
data.stubGenerator:
read H:int W:int
read a:int b:int

loop H read row:string(W)

write row col
Not Found
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[H]] and [[W]]
<<Line 2:>> Two space-separated integers [[a]] and [[b]]
<<Next [[H]] lines:>> A string of [[W]] integers, representing a row of the grid.

Where [[H]] and [[W]] is the height and length of the <<map>>, and [[a]] and [[b]] is the height and length of the <<house>>.
data.outputDescription:
If location found,
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[row]] and [[col]]
Otherwise,
<<Line 1:>> {{Not Found}}

Where [[row]] and [[col]] is the top-left coordinate (0-based) of the first valid area found.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A terrible tragedy has struck Bobsville, demolishing all of your father's work. As Bob the Builder, it is your duty to rebuild the town!

You’ve been given a plot of land represented by a 2D grid. Each cell contains a number from 1 to 3 (inclusive), indicating the elevation of that piece of land.

Bob wants to build rectangular homes of height a and length b. In order to maintain stability, the house can only be built on land that’s all at the same elevation and must not be rotated in any direction.

Your task is to output the top-left coordinate (0-based) of the first valid area found. If a valid area isn't found, output Not Found. The first valid area being the top-most and left-most coordinates.
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers H and W
Line 2: Two space-separated integers a and b
Next H lines: A string of W integers, representing a row of the grid.

Where H and W is the height and length of the map, and a and b is the height and length of the house.
Output
If location found,
Line 1: Two space-separated integers row and col
Otherwise,
Line 1: Not Found

Where row and col is the top-left coordinate (0-based) of the first valid area found.
Constraints
1 ≤ H, W ≤ 10
1 ≤ a, b ≤ 10
Example
Input
3 3
1 2
111
131
122
Output
0 0
